Description of incident: The vision exam dates, diagnoses, dates of birth, genders, identification numbers, and school names of students were accidentally made available to the public online between June 18 and July 31, 2013.  The breach was discovered on October 7 and the Chicago vision exam program information was removed.  The information was viewed by 14 people during that time.  All cached and archived versions of the information were also removed from the Internet.
